intro: Conophytum rufescens, commonly known as the red-stemmed conophytum, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its compact, fleshy leaves that store water, enabling it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the summer months, adding a delicate touch to its appearance. Its unique morphology and ability to survive in harsh conditions make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Conophytum rufescens requires minimal water and well-draining soil to flourish.
